div1.p: Hench discusses who was present when Moran was bitten by a mosquito. He believes the experiments themselves were meticulously done, but the records were either poorly kept or poorly preserved.

div1.head: Letter [fragment] from Philip Showalter Hench to Laura Wood, September 19, 1941
div1.opener:
Copy to Gen Truby
September 19, 1941
Miss Laura Wood
div1.p:
P. S. Let me give you the results of my efforts to determine just who
were present when Moran was first subjected to the experiments in Bldg. 2. Do you
have Senate Document 822, the official compilation of the yellow fever work? On
pages 10, 86 and 100 of this document it mentions two controls only being on Side A
(the mosquito-free side). These two controls were apparently non-immune volunteers
but they have never been identified. Moran doesn't recall who they were. On page
100 Reed says that the two controls continued to sleep in that room at night. On
page 99 Reed mentions two controls and one other non-immune who were on the opposite
side of the screen from Moran. Apparently this “other non-immune” was Reed himself.
Apparently he merely entered the mosquito-free side of the room briefly for the pur-
pose of seeing Moran bitten. This data I found in Agramonte's Scientific Monthly
article, Dec. 1915, on page 235 (bottom) where it says, “During this time two other
men and Major Reed remained in the other compartment, separated from Moran....etc.”
(This is why Miss Hallock had three figures drawn in the left box of the diagram
on p. 21 of the enclosed Metropolitan Life Insurance Company's pamphlet. But the
events pictured in Figures 1 and 3 on p. 21 never occurred, despite Gorgas' garbled
version given on p. 243 of the Senate Document).

see also Reed's letter to
General Sternberg of Jan 1 pp. 224 & 225
Sternberg Biography-

But in Miss Reed's manuscript I found still another version of the in-
cident. In the letter written by Reed to his family supposedly dated Dec. 26, 1900
Reed describes Moran's experiment and says, “I stood with Dr. Carroll and Dr. Ames
on the other side (of the screen) at the place marked “B” and saw the insect light..
etc. Bed marked “B” is being occupied by a non-immune who sleeps within one foot of
the screen, breathing the same air as in room with bed “A” (infected room). This
young non-immune is quite well, but the young fellow 'i.e. Moran) who went in on the
21st was suddenly stricken today at noon (Just four days after he entered and was
bitten) with a sharp attack of what promises to be yellow fever....etc.”

Obviously there is an error. The supposed date of this letter is Dec.
26 but I imagine the date has been misread and was really Dec. 25. Reed would hardly
have made a mistake in dating a letter on Christmas Day and yet the letter must have
been written then because (1) he speaks of Dec. 21 and then this noon, four days
later..etc. (2) also a glance at the official record of Moran's case with his fever
chart, etc. shows that Moran took sick (really) on Christmas Day, had a fever of
104 that afternoon but did not have a fever that high on the 26th.

One must conclude that there may have been, not two but perhaps five
persons in the mosquito-free side of Bldg. #2 when Moran was being bitten on the
other side. These were Drs. Reed, Carroll, Ames and at least one and probably two
non-immune volunteers. Why Reed should only mention one (“this young non-immune”)
in the letter to his family where everywhere else it speaks of two non-immune
volunteers I do not know. It's just one more of the scores and scores of contra-
dictions I've already found in the various official and unofficial records of the
experiments. One is almost tempted to complain that although the results of the
experiments were clear as crystal and the experiments themselves meticulously done,
the records regarding incidental details were rather sloppily kept (or poorly
remembered later).

Reed had no clerical
help and did all of his work with a
pen - Most of his records are clean and
concise with few errors. Most mistakes
were made later copying and with
very poor copy reading. The Senate Document
is full of errors-
